intro: Eudianthe lagrangei, commonly known as the Lagrange's eudianthe, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
